metadata.Description: Entrepreneurship focused on sustainable energy solutions and innovations.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
Entrepreneurship focused on sustainable energy solutions and innovations.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: climate change scenario analysis
relations.Description: Climate change scenario analysis implements sustainable energy projects to mitigate the impacts of climate change.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

Business models are a key sub-element of energy entrepreneurship. They define the structure and strategy of how energy entrepreneurs create, deliver, and capture value in the sustainable energy sector. Different business models can include pay-as-you-go, leasing, and energy service companies.
relations.Subject: business models

relations.Description: Startups are an important sub-element of energy entrepreneurship. They are newly established companies that aim to bring innovative and scalable solutions to the sustainable energy sector. Startups often face unique challenges such as access to funding, market entry, and scaling up.
relations.Subject: startups

relations.Description: Innovation is a crucial sub-element of energy entrepreneurship. It involves the development and implementation of new ideas, technologies, and processes to address sustainable energy challenges. Innovation can lead to breakthrough solutions, improved efficiency, and increased access to clean energy.
relations.Subject: innovation

relations.Description: Investment is a vital sub-element of energy entrepreneurship. It refers to the financial resources and funding that support the development and growth of sustainable energy ventures. Investment can come from various sources such as venture capital, impact investors, and government grants.
relations.Subject: investment

relations.Description: Policy support is a critical sub-element of energy entrepreneurship. It involves the creation and implementation of supportive policies and regulations that enable and incentivize the growth of sustainable energy businesses. Policy support can include feed-in tariffs, tax incentives, and supportive regulatory frameworks.
relations.Subject: policy support
